docs.snippet: According to Beijing’s bid, the impact from the Games would be “eco-friendly.” But conservationists say that holding the Games in a water-stressed environment would be devastating....
docs.lead_paragraph: According to Beijing’s bid, the impact from the Games would be “eco-friendly.” But conservationists say that holding the Games in a water-stressed environment would be devastating.
docs.abstract: Jiuzhanbao Journal; China, in bid to hold 2022 Winter Olympics, is building ski slopes in mountainous region around Beijing, despite fact that area is semiarid; local farmers are losing out on what little rain does fall because it is earmarked for making snow; hydrologists criticize practice, saying Beijing's ski resorts use about a billion gallons of water per year.

headline.main: Scientists Question Environmental Impact of China’s Winter Olympics Bid
headline.print_headline: China Seeks to Host the Winter Games Where Snow Rarely Falls

byline.contributor: Sarah Li and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.
